## Documentation Issue Summary

<!-- Briefly describe the documentation issue or improvement request. What documentation is missing, unclear, outdated, or incorrect? -->

## Type of Documentation Issue

<!-- Select all that apply -->

- [ ] **Missing Documentation** - Important feature or concept not documented
- [ ] **Incorrect Documentation** - Documentation contains errors or outdated information
- [ ] **Unclear Documentation** - Documentation is confusing or difficult to understand
- [ ] **Documentation Enhancement** - Existing documentation could be improved or expanded
- [ ] **Code Examples Needed** - Feature needs practical examples
- [ ] **API Documentation** - Missing or incomplete API reference
- [ ] **Tutorial/Guide Request** - Need step-by-step guide for a task

## Target Audience

<!-- Who is the primary audience for this documentation? -->

- [ ] **End Users** - People using the application
- [ ] **Contributors** - Developers contributing to the project
- [ ] **Maintainers** - Project maintainers and reviewers
- [ ] **New Contributors** - First-time contributors
- [ ] **API Users** - Developers using the API/library
- [ ] **GITHUB COPILOT** - Well-structured, easily parseable format for AI understanding

## Documentation Quality Checklist

<!-- Consider these aspects for high-quality documentation: -->

- [ ] Clear and concise language
- [ ] Accurate and up-to-date information
- [ ] Practical examples and use cases
- [ ] Proper formatting and structure
- [ ] Links to related documentation
- [ ] Code examples follow project conventions
- [ ] Accessible to target audience
- [ ] Searchable with relevant keywords

## Referential Transparency Considerations

<!-- For technical documentation, consider: -->
<!-- - Are pure functions clearly identified and explained? -->
<!-- - Is the distinction between pure business logic and side effects documented? -->
<!-- - Are function signatures and their guarantees clearly documented? -->
<!-- - Do examples demonstrate referential transparency principles? -->
<!-- See .github/REFERENTIAL_TRANSPARENCY.md for guidance -->

## Additional Context

<!-- Add any other context such as: -->
<!-- - Links to related issues or PRs -->
<!-- - Screenshots or examples from other projects -->
<!-- - User feedback or questions that prompted this -->
<!-- - External references or resources -->

## Priority Level

<!-- Select the appropriate priority level -->

- [ ] **Critical** - Critical feature undocumented, blocking users
- [ ] **High** - Important feature or common use case needs documentation
- [ ] **Medium** - Useful improvement that enhances understanding
- [ ] **Low** - Nice-to-have enhancement

## Acceptance Criteria

<!-- Define what "done" looks like for this documentation issue -->

- [ ] Documentation is created/updated
- [ ] Code examples are included and tested
- [ ] Documentation follows project style guide
- [ ] Cross-references to related docs are added
- [ ] Documentation is reviewed for accuracy
- [ ] Examples demonstrate best practices (pure functions, immutability)
- [ ] Documentation is linked from appropriate index files

**Related Guidelines:**
- For code quality standards: [CODE_REVIEW_GUIDE.md](../CODE_REVIEW_GUIDE.md)
- For testing documentation: [UNIT_TEST_GUIDE.md](../UNIT_TEST_GUIDE.md), [TDD_GUIDE.md](../TDD_GUIDE.md)

## Effort Estimation

<!-- Rough estimate of the effort required -->

- [ ] **Small** (< 2 hours) - Minor update or clarification
- [ ] **Medium** (2-8 hours) - New section or significant update
- [ ] **Large** (1-2 days) - New comprehensive guide or tutorial
- [ ] **Extra Large** (> 2 days) - Major documentation overhaul or multiple guides
